title: Why does the sound of children singing evoke creepiness in many horror movies? - Quora

response.answer_text: Juxtaposition: the fact of two things being seen or placed close together with contrasting effect, used to emphasize dissonance. Dissonance: a tension or clash resulting from the combination of two disharmonious or unsuitable elements.  Ex: creepy music with children laughing, or conversely happy music with children screaming... equally creepy. Happy music with unsettling lyrics (ring around the rosey)Happy instruments played in a minor key (deliverance banjo)Happy Music with unsettling imagery (superman vs. batman trailer, steely dan scene from reservoir dogs)
